CI.description: Flag that script running in continuous integration environment

CI_COMMIT_REF_NAME.description: Git ref of commit on which pipeline running

CI_COMMIT_SHA.description: The SHA of commit where pipeline running

CI_COMMIT_TAG.description: The commit tag name. Available only in pipelines for tags

CI_PIPELINE_URL.description: Url of pipeline where pvm running

CI_PROJECT_ID.description: Project ID in vcs platform. Used in calls to vcs platform api.

CI_PROJECT_NAMESPACE.description: The project namespace (username or group name)

CI_PROJECT_PATH.description: The project namespace with the project name included

DEBUG.description: If set with 'pvm' string, then treated as PVM_LL=debug

GITHUB_HEAD_REF.description: The head ref or source branch of the pull request in a workflow run. This property is only set when the event that triggers a workflow run is either pull_request or pull_request_target. For example, feature-branch-1.

GITHUB_REF_NAME.description: The branch or tag name that triggered the workflow run.

GITHUB_REF_TYPE.description: The type of ref that triggered the workflow run. Valid values are branch or tag

GITHUB_REPOSITORY.description: The owner and repository name. For example, octocat/Hello-World.

GITHUB_RUN_ID.description: A unique number for each run within a repository. This number does not change if you re-run the workflow run

GITHUB_SERVER_URL.description: Returns the URL of the GitHub server. For example: https://github.com.

GITHUB_SHA.description: The commit SHA that triggered the workflow

GITHUB_TOKEN.description:
Token, provided by github and used for token authentication https://github.com/octokit/authentication-strategies.js/#github-action-authentication

It can also be personal or app access token, manually provided via secrets

GITLAB_AUTH_COMMAND.description: Shell command that outputs generated GITLAB_TOKEN. Used when token generating dynamically.

GITLAB_TOKEN.description: User or bot gitlab token, that have access rights for creating merge requests and commiting to protected branches

GITLAB_USER_EMAIL.description: Email of gitlab user, who start's publish pipeline

GIT_DEPTH.description:
Gitlab specific. Amount of commits that are fetching in CI environment. Useful when amount commits between releases is big enough ' +
'that previous release falls outside of fetched commits count.

GIT_SSH_PRIV_KEY.description: SSH private key to push to vcs platform from CI via git

NPM_TOKEN.description: NPM registry token with publish access

PVM_CONFIG_SEARCH_FROM.description: What directory pvm config to search from. Default is current working directory.

PVM_EXTERNAL_DRY_RUN.description: Enable dry run mode for all pvm commands who support's it

PVM_FORCE_TEST_PUBLISH.description: Used when we want to do real publish to registry in tests (useful in e2e publish test)

PVM_GITHUB_AUTH_STRATEGY.description: Github authentication strategy. See https://github.com/octokit/authentication-strategies.js/ for more details

PVM_MATTERMOST_INCOMING_WEBHOOK.description:
Optional incoming webhook. https://docs.mattermost.com/developer/webhooks-incoming.html.
It will be used prior to token if specified

PVM_MATTERMOST_TEAM.description:
If provided than mattermost client will try first to get channel id from team and passed channel and, if failed,
then try to use channel as channel_id.

PVM_MATTERMOST_TOKEN.description: Private access token for mattermost. Can be bot or regular user token

PVM_MATTERMOST_URL.description: Mattermost endpoint url. Will be postfixed with api method path

PVM_NO_GIT_FETCH.description: Disable default `get fetch` call before pvm starts work when in CI

PVM_PLATFORM_TYPE.description: Manually set vcs platform type (gitlab or github)

PVM_TESTING_ENV.description: Flag that pvm running in testing environment

PVM_TEST_DATE_NOW.description: Replace current time with provided. Useful in tests.

PVM_VCS_TYPE.description: Manually set vcs type (git or local fs)

SLACK_TOKEN.description: Slack bot token that have post message access in target channel

STOP_AT.description: Set lower commits bound when generating fresh releases list
